documentation.text:
@dev Base authorization layer implementation for Pools.
 The owner account can call some of the permissioned functions - access control of the rest is delegated to the
 Authorizer. Note that this owner is immutable: more sophisticated permission schemes, such as multiple ownership,
 granular roles, etc., could be built on top of this by making the owner a smart contract.
 Access control of all other permissioned functions is delegated to an Authorizer. It is also possible to delegate
 control of *all* permissioned functions to the Authorizer by setting the owner address to `_DELEGATE_OWNER`.

 The owner account can call some of the permissioned functions - access control of the rest is delegated to the
 Authorizer. Note that this owner is immutable: more sophisticated permission schemes, such as multiple ownership,
 granular roles, etc., could be built on top of this by making the owner a smart contract.
 Access control of all other permissioned functions is delegated to an Authorizer. It is also possible to delegate
 control of *all* permissioned functions to the Authorizer by setting the owner address to `_DELEGATE_OWNER`.

devdoc.details: Base authorization layer implementation for Pools. The owner account can call some of the permissioned functions - access control of the rest is delegated to the Authorizer. Note that this owner is immutable: more sophisticated permission schemes, such as multiple ownership, granular roles, etc., could be built on top of this by making the owner a smart contract. Access control of all other permissioned functions is delegated to an Authorizer. It is also possible to delegate control of *all* permissioned functions to the Authorizer by setting the owner address to `_DELEGATE_OWNER`.

getActionId(bytes4).details: Returns the action identifier associated with the external function described by `selector`.
